sync.db.mysql

Class DBSyncAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • sync.db.mysql.DBSyncAgent

  • public class DBSyncAgent
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this class serves as the agent for the synchronization process. All synchronization tasks are handed over to an object of this class, which then takes the required steps to perform the actual synchronization depending on its set properties. It requires all details for establishing a connection to the server and client MySQL servers and some additional synchronization specific properties.

    An object of this class is created using the Builder pattern as opposed to the usual constructor based initialization.

    An example on using the Builder pattern to create a new DBSyncObject:

     DBSyncAgent dbSyncAgent = new DBSyncAgent.Builder()
                            .setServerDatabaseAddress("localhost")
                            .setServerDatabaseName("test1")
                            .setServerDatabaseUsername("root")
                            .setServerDatabasePassword("root")
                            .setServerDatabasePort(3306)
                            .setServerDatabaseConnectionOptions("?useSSL=false")
                            .setClientDatabaseAddress("localhost")
                            .setClientDatabaseName("test2")
                            .setClientDatabaseUsername("root")
                            .setClientDatabasePassword("root")
                            .setClientDatabasePort(3306)
                            .setClientDatabaseConnectionOptions("?useSSL=false")
                            .setDBMap(dbMap)
                            .setSyncInterval(12)
                            .build();
    See Also:
    DBSyncAgent(sync.db.mysql.DBSyncAgent.Builder)

    • Method Detail

      • setSyncInterval

        public void setSyncInterval(int syncInterval)
        Set the synchronization interval. This specifies the time interval between two successive synchronization attempts during a live sync. Specified in seconds.
        Parameters:
        syncInterval - synchronization interval in seconds

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connects to the client and server databases as per the set properties.

      • sync

        public void sync()
        Performs initial synchronization between the client and the server databases. When synchronization is done for the first time or after a reasonable interval of time, call this function before calling the liveSync().

      • liveSync

        public void liveSync()
        Synchronizes the client and the server databases periodically. This synchronization is done periodically as specified using setSyncInterval(int) or initialized using the Builder pattern.

      • stopSync

        public void stopSync()
        Stops the synchronization process. The current transaction will be finished before the stop takes places to make sure the database is in proper state.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects the existing client and server connections safely. Call this method after calling stopSync().
